# ðŸ“Š Sales Data Analysis Project

## ðŸ“Œ Overview
This project performs end-to-end Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) on a retail sales dataset to uncover revenue trends, profitability drivers, and the impact of discount strategies on business performance.

The analysis focuses on identifying loss-making transactions, category efficiency, regional performance, and pricing strategy insights.

---

## ðŸ“Š Key Insights

- 19% of total transactions are loss-making.
- Discounts above 30% significantly reduce profitability.
- Technology and Office Supplies maintain ~17% profit margin.
- Furniture operates at only ~2.5% margin.
- Central region shows structural profitability issues.
- Texas operates at -15% margin due to aggressive discounting.
- Sales and Profit show moderate positive correlation (0.48).
- Discount negatively impacts Profit (-0.22 correlation).

---

## ðŸ“ˆ Business Recommendations

- Limit discounts to â‰¤20% to maintain healthy margins.
- Re-evaluate pricing strategy in Central region.
- Improve margin efficiency in Furniture category.
- Focus expansion on high-margin Technology products.

---

## ðŸ’¼ Project Outcome
This project demonstrates practical data analysis skills including data cleaning, exploratory data analysis (EDA), visualization, correlation analysis, and business insight generation.
